title: How to Exercise Properly for People over 65 Years Old

steps.headline: Start with a light walk.
steps.description: Try to walk outside rather than on a treadmill. Do this for 5-15 minutes.

steps.headline: Bump up the pace, so you are JUST BARELY outside your comfort zone.
Do some weight-lifting exercise.
steps.description: Use one- to five-five pound weights, whichever you feel comfortable with. Do any kind of weight-lifting exercise you wish, but do no more than ten repetitions.

steps.headline: Stretch your legs and walk back to your home.
Drink water.
steps.description: It's important to stay hydrated during your workout.

tyn: A set of one- to five-pound weights.
A Good trail/Path to walk on
text: Start with a light walk. Try to walk outside rather than on a treadmill. Do this for 5-15 minutes. Bump up the pace, so you are JUST BARELY outside your comfort zone. Continue walking for 3-7 minutes. Take a one-minute break. Flex your ankles and wrists. Do some weight-lifting exercise. Use one- to five-five pound weights, whichever you feel comfortable with. Do any kind of weight-lifting exercise you wish, but do no more than ten repetitions. Do some gentle arm stretches.  Stretch your legs and walk back to your home.  Drink water. It's important to stay hydrated during your workout.
sentences: Try to walk outside rather than on a treadmill.
Bump up the pace, so you are JUST BARELY outside your comfort zone.
Use one- to five-five pound weights, whichever you feel comfortable with.
Do any kind of weight-lifting exercise you wish, but do no more than ten repetitions.
Stretch your legs and walk back to your home.
It's important to stay hydrated during your workout.
